version_description: Tube Map has been updated with the latest official Transport for London Night Tube map which now includes the Jubilee line.
Tube Map has been updated with the latest Transport for London Night Tube map which now includes the Northern line.

NEW for Christmas! We've added a Tube Map of the North Pole to give the app a little festive magic! See how to get from Winter Wonderland to Santa’s Workshop using the Comet line and search the map for hidden elves and candy canes. There is also the chance to win £1,000 with an interactive competition! The Xmas tab is available on the map screen and all of the terms and conditions are available at www.mapway.com/blog.

Also new to this update is additional information in the route planner showing you alternative travel options. This new feature compares live travelling times and estimated prices of getting the bus or catching an Uber so you can find the best option for your journey.
A couple of bug fixes.
Tube Map has been updated with the latest Night Tube Map from TfL including the Piccadilly line.
This update includes a few bug fixes and performance improvements.
Map update to show the re-opening of both Lambeth North and the overground line from Gospel Oak to Barking.
This update includes a few bug fixes and performance improvements.
This update includes a few bug fixes and performance improvements.
Thanks for using Tube Map. This update includes a few bug fixes and performance improvements.
Thanks for using Tube Map. This update includes a few bug fixes and performance improvements.
Thanks for using Tube Map. This update includes a few bug fixes and performance improvements.
This update includes the latest map from Transport for London showing the reopening of Lancaster Gate station and adding Charing Cross station to the Night Tube map.
This map update from Transport for London shows step free access at Victoria Station on the Victoria line.
This update includes a couple of bug fixes. Thank you for using Tube Map!

For anyone who didn't know that Tube Map is more than just a map, we've added in some helpful hints to show you the amazing features you might have missed.
There’s an update to the Night Tube Map for the launch of the new London Overground Night Service and Tube Map is now also fully optimised for iPhone X!

We’ve updated Tube Map’s route planner to help you get around London as fast and as cheap as possible! At a glance, you’ll see the best routes to take with live information that could save you time and money each time you travel.

This update also includes the latest Tube Map from Transport for London, showing the reopening of Custom House DLR station.

We've fixed an issue that some of our iPad users were having when viewing the map. We're 99.99% sure the app is working perfectly again but if you do spot any funny business, please email us at support@mapway.com. Thanks!
The Night Tube map has been updated to show the new service to Canonbury that links the Overground to Highbury and Islington and the Victoria line. Thanks for using Tube Map!
This update includes a couple of bug fixes and a few performance improvements. Thanks for using Tube Map!
This update includes a couple of bug fixes and a few performance improvements. Thanks for using Tube Map!

Notifications have moved! Now you can customise your alerts directly from the line status page. Press "Edit" and drag your favourite lines to the top of the page. Set notifications for when you need them so you can be the first to know about changes when they happen.

We hope you continue to enjoy using Tube Map.

Introducing the latest official Tube Map from TfL. The map includes a new TfL Rail line from Paddington to Heathrow and an extension to the tram lines.
If you missed our last update, notifications have moved. You can now find them on the Line Status page.

We hope you continue to enjoy using Tube Map.

Thank you for downloading the app. We regularly update the app to make it better for you.
To make sure you don’t miss a thing, just keep your updates turned on.
Got a question? Tap Support in the About section in the app.

Thank you for downloading the app. We regularly update the app to make it better for you.
This update includes some bug fixes and performance improvements.
To make sure you don’t miss a thing, just keep your updates turned on.
Got a question? Tap Support in the About section in the app.

When you tap on a station we’ve added lots more information, including:
•Platform Accessibility
•Station Facilities (Wi-Fi, Ticket Machines, Pay Phones, Gates, Shops, Escalators, Lifts, Car parks, Bike stands, Taxi ranks,)
•Information about the Station (Station History, Things to look out for, Fun facts)

We’ve also fixed a few bugs in the direction of travel.
If you have any questions, tap on ‘support’ in the About section and we’ll be happy to help you out.

We’ve listened to your feedback and have overhauled our Line Status page. It’s now even simpler to choose the lines important to you and get alerted to any problems as they happen.
Planning ahead? We’ve added a new Planned Works tab so you can see any upcoming disruptions for the next couple of weeks.
We’ve also added a Home and Work stop into Favourites, so you can route to and from home and work with ease.
If you have any feedback, drop us an email: support@mapway.com

• Faster results
